author: @thecooldown.com
title: Influencer calls out exhausting fashion habit sweeping popular culture: 'It's just virtue signaling'
text:
Fast fashion isn't just bad for the environment; it's not even good fashion, according to a viral TikTok video from alana likes to thrift (@atlantawithouthetea), an account known for her creative thrift store fashion finds.
The TikToker puts fashion trends on blast for not only contributing to wasteful practices, but for flying in the face of what fashion is supposed to be: creative, individual, expressive.
@atlantawithouthetea subtitle is why i disliike the term & identity of "fashion girly" #rant #yap #coldtake #fashiontiktok #microtrend #trendcycle #overconsumption â™¬ original sound - alana likes to thrift ðŸ‘œðŸ“€ðŸ’­ "It's just virtue signaling," she says in the clip. It's about the item's brand and showing you know what's popular, not about what you actually want to express through your clothes, she says.
Part of her beef is how quickly these fashion "microtrends" cycle in and out of style, rendering clothes dated within weeks sometimes and perpetuating a cycle of consumerism that strains the world's resources and landfills.
"What's the point?" she seems to be asking. If you're going to engage in an environmentally harmful practice, you may as well look good, but people aren't even achieving that, she says.
And her followers largely seem to agree.
FROM OUR PARTNER Use this simple tool to keep your personal data from scammers Every day, data brokers profit from your sensitive info â€” like your phone number, date of birth, and social security number â€” by selling it to the highest bidder.
And whoâ€™s buying it? Best case: companies that target you with ads. Worst case: scammers and identity thieves. Thatâ€™s why itâ€™s time to check out Incogni .
Incogniâ€™s innovative personal data removal service scrubs your personal information from the web , confronting the worldâ€™s data brokers on your behalf. And unlike other services, Incogni helps remove your sensitive information from all broker types, including those tricky â€œ people search sites .â€
Help protect yourself from identity theft, spam calls, and health insurers trying to raise your rates.
Plus: For a limited time, TCD readers get 55% off using code COOLDOWN.
Learn more â†’ Watch now: This classic mac and cheese brand just won an award for its packaging design "Honestly I loooove people who aren't into 'fashion' cause their closets are so curated in a way that matches their lifestyle, values, and personality so much more than said fashion people," one follower said .
Not immediately jumping on new trends is one way to avoid this pattern, another user said. "This is why I wait months to buy anything new to make sure I actually want it and understand why I want it," the user wrote .
The fatigue with overconsumption and a loss of individuality rang out in the comment section.
"I can't stannnnd micro trends and I'm so exhausted by over consumption. Trendy does not equal good taste," another user summed it up .
What should the government do about the fast fashion industry?
Set strict regulations ðŸš«
Incentivize sustainable options ðŸ’°
Use both regulations and incentives ðŸ›ï¸
Nothing ðŸ™…
Click your choice to see results and speak your mind.
In other words, the advice here is not really that owning clothes that fit a trend is bad. It's that regularly buying a newly manufactured item, often shipped to your door, just to keep up with a trend is not a healthy pattern .
If you're going to buy a new piece of clothing, commit to keeping and wearing it many times. Or consider buying secondhand â€” or at least from a brand that emphasizes sustainability and durability.
Join our free newsletter for easy tips to save more and waste less , and don't miss this cool list of easy ways to help yourself while helping the planet.

author: finanzen.net
title: Chick-fil-A's Winter Forecast: Sunny, With a Chance of Mango Passion | finanzen.net
text:
Chick-fil-A's Winter Forecast: Sunny, With a Chance of Mango Passion 04.01.24 14:47 Uhr Werbung Mango Passion Sunjoy Ã‚ Ã‚Â® Ã‚ returns to menus nationwide alongside expanded selection of Mango Passion beverages
ATLANTA , Jan. 4, 2024 /PRNewswire/ -- Chick-fil-A Ã‚Â® is bringing a bright and sunny outlook to the start of the year with the return of the Mango Passion Sunjoy Ã‚Â® , along with three new tropical sidekicks: Mango Passion Lemonade , Mango Passion Iced Tea and Mango Passion Frosted Lemonade .
Today's Outlook: A Taste of the Tropics
Whatever the weather, starting January 8 guests can pick their paradise and sip their way into sunshine with a selection of new and returning beverages at participating restaurants nationwide, while supplies last:
Mango PassionÃ‚ Sunjoy Ã‚Â® This refreshing beverage combines Chick-fil-A's Sunjoy Ã‚ Ã‚Â® beverage (Chick-fil-A Ã‚Â® Lemonade and freshly-brewed Sweetened Iced Tea) with delicious mango and passion fruit flavors.
New! Mango Passion Lemonade This tropical combination is a mix of classic Chick-fil-A Ã‚Â® Lemonade and delicious mango and passion fruit flavors.
New! Mango Passion Iced Tea Freshly-brewed daily from a blend of tea leaves, the Mango Passion Iced Tea mixes classic Iced Tea with delicious mango and passion fruit flavors.
New! Mango Passion Frosted Lemonade The perfect winter sweet treat, combining Chick-fil-A Ã‚Â® Lemonade (or Diet Lemonade) and signature Icedream Ã‚Â® dessert with delicious mango and passion fruit flavors. "Customers loved the Mango Passion flavor when it was on our menu in 2020, so we are thrilled to bring it back with even more flavor offerings for guests to enjoy," said Allison Duncan , Director, Menu & Packaging. "We're seeing a growing demand for cold and iced beverages from consumers throughout the year, with recent enthusiasm for our Watermelon Mint and White Peach beverages, as well as our new Peppermint beverages this winter. We're excited to surprise guests with bright new flavors that will redefine our seasonal beverages!"
A Warm (and Spicy) Front Ahead
To pair with the sweet mango and passion fruit flavors, Chick-fil-A recommends enjoying the new beverages with a spicy side kick, the Spicy Deluxe Sandwich . A classic current menu item, this signature entrÃƒÂ©e serves as the perfect way to beat the winter blues. Featuring a boneless breast of chicken seasoned to perfection, the Spicy Deluxe Sandwich can be customized to include three different variations of cheese, a combination of tomato, lettuce and pickles, as well as a toasted, buttery white or multigrain bun.
Customers can check the Chick-fil-A Ã‚Â® App or contact their local restaurant to find out if these menu items are served at a nearby location for dine-in, pick up or delivery. To read the latest information about Chick-fil-A's menu, innovations and more, visit chick-fil-a.com/stories .
About Chick-fil-A, Inc. Ã‚ Ã‚
Chick-fil-A, Inc. is the third largest quick-service restaurantÃ‚ company in the United States , known for its freshly-prepared food, signature hospitality and unique franchise model.Ã‚ More than 200,000 Team Members are employed by independentÃ‚ owner-operators in more than 3,000 restaurants across the United States , Canada , and Puerto Rico . In 2023, the company shared plans to expand by 2030 into Europe and Asia.Ã‚ Chick-fil-A owner-operators live and work in the communities their restaurants serve,Ã‚ each supporting local efforts to address hunger, education, and making a positive impact. The family-owned and privately held company was founded in 1967 by S. Truett Cathy .Ã‚ More information on Chick-fil-A is available atÃ‚ www.chick-fil-a.com Ã‚ andÃ‚ @ChickfilANews .Ã‚ Ã‚
Twitter: @ChickfilANews
View original content to download multimedia: https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/chick-fil-as-winter-forecast-sunny-with-a-chance-of-mango-passion-302025683.html
SOURCE Chick-fil-A, Inc.

title: Aterrador hallazgo: hombre fue asesinado a puÃ±aladas en su casa | Vanguardia.com
text: Los investigadores estÃ¡n intentando determinar quiÃ©n se encontraba con la vÃ­ctima en la vivienda antes del ataque. Hasta ahora, no se han esclarecido las causas del crimen ni se ha identificado a los responsables. En las Ãºltimas horas, las autoridades hallaron a un hombre sin vida en el patio de su residencia, situada en una zona rural del municipio de Valdivia, en el norte de Antioquia. El hecho tuvo lugar en la vereda El Socorro, donde la vÃ­ctima, identificada como Dayner Vergara Loaiza, fue descubierta con heridas de arma blanca en el tÃ³rax y la cabeza. [Judicial](/judicial/)11:43 PM PolicÃ­a entregÃ³ detalles del atentado con arma de fuego a un hombre en un restaurante de CaÃ±averal [Judicial 1](/people/judicial-1) [Judicial](/judicial/)11:43 PM [MÃ¡s Podcast](/podcast) No olvide leer: [Hombre fue capturado por abusar a una mujer con discapacidad en Santander](https://www.vanguardia.com/judicial/2024/06/13/hombre-fue-capturado-por-abusar-a-una-mujer-con-discapacidad-en-santander/) Los investigadores estÃ¡n intentando determinar quiÃ©n se encontraba con la vÃ­ctima en la vivienda antes del ataque. Hasta ahora, no se han esclarecido las causas del crimen ni se ha identificado a los responsables. El cuerpo ha sido trasladado a la morgue del municipio para la autopsia correspondiente. Hallan un cadÃ¡ver en descomposiciÃ³n en MedellÃ­n Este miÃ©rcoles 12 de junio, las autoridades de policÃ­a del Ãrea Metropolitana encontraron en una casa de San Javier, occidente de MedellÃ­n, el cuerpo de un hombre muerto en estado de descomposiciÃ³n sin signos aparentes de violencia. Al parecer, [la vÃ­ctima, de 41 aÃ±os, llevaba desaparecida varios dÃ­as y fueron sus compaÃ±eros de trabajo, quienes al ver que llevaba tres dÃ­as sin ir a trabajar contactaron a un hermano](https://www.vanguardia.com/judicial/2024/06/12/investigan-muerte-de-taxista-arrollado-por-su-propio-carro/) y lo pusieron al tanto de la situaciÃ³n. Ante el llamado de alerta, el hermano fue a la casa, ubicada en el barrio 20 de Julio, donde tambiÃ©n vive su madre de 86 aÃ±os. Le recomendamos leer: [AtenciÃ³n: Atentado con arma de fuego en CaÃ±averal dejÃ³ una persona gravemente herida](https://www.vanguardia.com/judicial/2024/06/13/atencion-atentado-con-arma-de-fuego-en-canaveral-dejo-una-persona-gravemente-herida/) De acuerdo con el reporte de la PolicÃ­a, nadie le abriÃ³ la puerta, pero desde afuera se sentÃ­a el olor a â€œputrefactoâ€ y se veÃ­a una gran cantidad de moscas. Con ayuda de los bomberos consiguieron entrar a la casa, donde encontraron una escena impactante. La adulta mayor estaba sentada en una silla en la sala en estado de desnutriciÃ³n y en aparente shock, mientras que el hombre estaba muerto en el baÃ±o; el cuerpo presentaba alto grado de descomposiciÃ³n. Las razones de la muerte del hombre, de 41 aÃ±os y cuya identidad no fue revelada, son materia de investigaciÃ³n. Los investigadores estÃ¡n intentando esclarecer el caso y determinar quÃ© fue lo que ocurriÃ³ dentro del inmueble con el hombre y la adulta mayor.

author: Brian Otieno
title: Echoes of fallout as Ruto, DP fail to present one front over tax protests - The Standard
text: Nairobi looked like a war zone before and after the military met protesters in the cityâ€™s downtown. As the imposing armoured personnel carriers rolled into town, cheers erupted. The masses chanted â€œRuto must goâ€ and â€œjeshi yetuâ€ as they escorted Kenya Defence Forces (KDF) officers on patrol, an unexpected turn of events. On Tuesday, President William Ruto said the governmentâ€™s response to the anti-tax protests had reached a turning point, announcing a crackdown against protesters that would spare no one. The [deployment of the KDF](https://www.standardmedia.co.ke/national/article/2001497932/questions-as-mps-speedily-approve-deployment-of-kdf) marked the escalation of the governmentâ€™s response, with their presence observed by Kenyans on X as â€œintimidation tacticsâ€. An uneasy calm had swept through the city Thursday morning, with pockets of anti-Ruto protests erupting in the afternoon. And despite the promised 10-million countrywide march failing to materialise, there was general paralysis not just of Nairobi, stagnant with the stench of teargas, but other parts of the country. The bigger paralysis exists in the government. On the eve of a planned march to State House, a day the nation expected a united response to its current crisis, Kenyaâ€™s top leadership were at loggerheads. As they crackdown on protesters, the police have turned a blind eye to armed military officers, amid accusations that the latter were sponsored by the State. Armed persons on Thursday patrolled Nairobi and Eldoret, with many questioning why the police let them roam free. Barely hours after the President yielded to public pressure and withdrew the [controversial Finance Bill](https://www.standardmedia.co.ke/explainers/article/2001497926/explainer-what-happens-when-the-president-withdraws-a-bill), Deputy President Rigathi Gachagua was throwing intelligence agencies under the bus. Ahead of the briefing, many, wondered why the pair did not present a united front, thus speculating a bitter fallout. Gachagua missed the State House address, holding a press briefing in Mombasa. And both men would expose contradictions in the Executiveâ€™s stance. Ruto, who hours earlier had promised a crackdown, had changed tune, saying he was willing to engage protesting youth. But, as observed by Kenyans on X, who had logged into a Space meeting of more than 100,000 participants, there were inconsistencies in the Presidentâ€™s words and his governmentâ€™s actions. For starters, he only acknowledged the deaths of six protesters against evidence that more than 20 Kenyans died in the demos. Similarly, abductions of influential social media users went on Wednesday evening, with brutality witnessed against protesters yesterday. Four demonstrators were shot in Migori. Many had wanted better handling of protesters, with international community urging restraint and investigations into incidents of alleged police brutality. Stay informed. Subscribe to our newsletter On Wednesday, Ruto said those killed in the demos would be â€œaccounted forâ€, but did not specify the actions that would follow. The inconsistencies also featured on Gachaguaâ€™s speech. While the Deputy President issued a passionate defence of the Head of State, he said he was not aware that the masses were against the Finance Bill. On the same breath, he would claim that the government had stopped listening to the masses. By targeting National Intelligence Service (NIS) Director-General Noordin Haji, the deputy president risked taking back the nation back to an era Kenya Kwanza said belonged to the past - an era of intimidation against holders of critical office. His speech came amid a power tussle pitting the President and his deputy, with claims that the NIS had planned to â€˜frameâ€™ Gachagua for the protests pointing to a worsening situation. Such dysfunction has led many questioning the Kenya Kwanzaâ€™s capacity to govern. â€œThis government has lost it. It must go now. 2027 is too far to wait. Once people have lost confidence in you, just leave. Kenya needs a fresh start,â€ lawyer Ekuru Aukot posted on X. Parliament, it seems, has lost all its trust among the public diminished. MPs, who Wednesday angered Kenyans by clapping behind the Head of State, played deaf to calls by Kenyans to reject the bill, which led to an invasion of the august House and the setting ablaze of a section of it. A raft of demands, allegedly by the protesters, lay bare their mistrust in the political class. Among them include the reconstitution of the electoral commission to facilitate the recalling of all Members of Parliament and Rutoâ€™s resignation. â€œThis government has lost it. It must go now. 2027 is too far to wait. Once people have lost confidence in you, just leave. Kenya needs a fresh start,â€ lawyer Ekuru Aukot posted on X. Law Society of Kenya President Faith Odhiambo called for the disbandment of unnecessary offices overburdening a cash-strapped mwananchi. â€œWe need to see all unconstitutional offices scrapped off. We donâ€™t want to hear about CASs, the offices of the wife of the President, the wife of the Deputy President, and the wife of the Prime Minister. Itâ€™s these heavy expenditures that are cutting out money that should go into healthcare and education,â€ she said.

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: New York Rangers' Ultimate All Free Agent Team Celebrating 25 Years
text:
New York Rangersâ€™ Ultimate All Free Agent Team Celebrating 25 Years
The New York Rangers are celebrating the last 25 years with their Quarter Century All Free Agent Team, highlighting significant players acquired through free agency. This roster underscores the organization's historical inclination to spend big in the free agent market, with a mix of successful signings who significantly contributed to the team's playoff runs. Notable names include Artemi Panarin, Michael Nylander, and Marian Gaborik, each making lasting impacts during their tenures. The team will be announced officially on January 26, but fans can expect a variety of perspectives on players' contributions through a series of articles. This release aims to reflect on both the successes and struggles faced during the Rangers' extensive free agency history.
- Artemi Panarin: 169 goals and 341 assists for 510 points in 395 games.
- Marian Gaborik: 114 goals and 115 assists for 229 points in 255 games.
While the Rangers have seen success with several marquee signings, their history includes many costly mistakes, often resulting in contracts awarded to players past their prime or ill-suited for their roles, complicating their strategies over the years.
State of Play- The Rangers are currently focusing on rebuilding and re-establishing themselves as a playoff contender.
- Fan engagement is expected to peak around the announcement of the Quarter Century team, with discussions about player legacies and signings erupting on social media platforms.
Anticipation is building for the official release of the team on January 26, which may lead to renewed discussions about the Rangers' approach in future offseasons and potential changes in their free agency strategy.
Bottom LineThe Rangers' Quarter Century All Free Agent Team offers a moment to reflect on the team's journey through free agency, spotlighting both triumphs and challenges, ultimately emphasizing the importance of thoughtful acquisitions in achieving team success.
